meanings.definition: Alloys with high strength and resistance to heat and corrosion, used in extreme environments.
meanings.sent1: The superalloys in the jet engine allowed it to withstand the intense heat of takeoff.
meanings.sent2: Aerospace engineers rely on superalloys to create components that can endure extreme conditions.
meanings.sent3: The superalloys at the party were the strongest, resisting even the hottest salsa.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like superalloys, unyielding in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The superalloys gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing their strength and resilience.

meanings.definition: Materials made by combining metals to create a stronger and more durable substance.
meanings.sent1: The superalloys used in construction projects ensure the buildings are sturdy and long-lasting.
meanings.sent2: Manufacturers choose superalloys for their ability to enhance the durability of various products.
meanings.sent3: The superalloys in the playground equipment made it nearly indestructible, much to the delight of the children.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like superalloys, blending together to form a bond that could not be broken.
meanings.sent5: The superalloys in the sword gave it an unmatched strength, making it a formidable weapon.
